titleStmt.title: Description of University of Pennsylvania LJS 37: Ikhtiṣār lil-maqālāt min kitāb Uqlīdis.

licence.#text: These images and the content of Kislak Center for Special Collections, Rare Books and Manuscripts LJS 37: Ikhtiṣār lil-maqālāt min kitāb Uqlīdis. are free of known copyright restrictions and in the public domain. msIdentifier.repository: Kislak Center for Special Collections, Rare Books and Manuscripts

msContents.summary: Incomplete abridgment in Arabic of Euclid's Elements, written on paper. The first 6 leaves (f. i-5) are replacements, written on different paper in a later hand. The replacement title page gives the incorrect title Taḥrīr Uqlīdis kāmil (Complete edition of Euclid, usually used to refer to the version edited by Naṣīr al-Dīn al-Ṭūsī, which this is not).

supportDesc.extent: 93 leaves : 188 x 100 (145 x 60) mm. bound to 192 x 105 mm

collation.p: Paper, i (endleaf)+6 (18th-century paper?)+87+i (endleaf) ; 1² 2⁴ 3-5¹⁰ 6¹⁴ 7⁶ 8¹⁴(-1) 9¹⁶ 10⁶ 11² ; [i, 1-92]; quire marks on upper left margin recto; modern foliation in pencil, upper left recto.

layoutDesc.layout: Written in 15 long lines; ruled with a misṭarah with approximately 8 mm. between lines, a standard measurement for manuscripts written in Egypt.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Written in naskh in dark brown ink; partially pointed.

decoNote: Illustrated throughout with small geometric diagrams in red ink; rubrications including headings and overlines in red.

binding.p: Contemporary morocco blind-stamped with a knotted rope medallion on both covers, rebacked; leather doublure.

origin.p: Written in Fatimid Egypt, Iraq, or Syria, between A.H. Jumādá al-Ūlá and Ramaḍān 502 (Dec. 1108-April 1109), (f. 24v, 49r).

provenance: Sold by Sam Fogg Ltd. (London), June 1995, to Lawrence J. Schoenberg.
Deposit by Lawrence J. Schoenberg and Barbara Brizdle, 2011.
